turn.1: What is the meaning of Church of the Assumption (Uzundzhovo)?
turn.2: Church of the Assumption (Uzundzhovo) The Church of the Dormition of the Holy Mother of God (Bogoroditsa) (, "tsarkva "Uspenie Bogorodichno"") is a Bulgarian Orthodox church in the village of Uzundzhovo, Haskovo Municipality, Bulgaria.
turn.4: Built as a mosque during the Ottoman era, it was reconstructed in 1906 as a church.
turn.5: Why was it built as a mosque?
turn.6: According to local legend, Ottoman conquerors destroyed the originally existing Bulgarian village and church.
turn.8: Under Sultan Bayezid II's order, a caravanserai for traveling merchants was then built, around which a Turkish hamlet called Uzunca Ova (Uzundzhovo) arose.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?

turn.12: Austrian historian Hammer also confirms this assertion, with documents that show Sinan had issued 30,000 qirsh in 1593 for the construction of a mosque, caravanserai, imaret, and bathhouse in what became known as Uzundzhovo.
